question: What is the primary purpose of Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) in AWS?

answers.text: Managing storage resources
Managing compute resources
Distributing incoming application traffic across multiple targets
Configuring network security for EC2 instances

question: Which load balancer types are provided by AWS Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: Application Load Balancer (ALB) and Network Load Balancer (NLB)
Classic Load Balancer (CLB) and Resource Load Balancer (RLB)
HTTP Load Balancer (HLB) and TCP Load Balancer (TLB)
Service Load Balancer (SLB) and Elastic Load Distributor (ELD)

question: What is the key feature of an Application Load Balancer (ALB) in AWS?

answers.text: Support for TCP traffic
Support for UDP traffic
Layer 7 routing and content-based routing
Connection draining for EC2 instances

question: How does a Network Load Balancer (NLB) differ from an Application Load Balancer (ALB)?

answers.text: NLB is designed for HTTP/HTTPS traffic, while ALB is for TCP/UDP traffic
NLB operates at Layer 4 (TCP/UDP), while ALB operates at Layer 7 (HTTP/HTTPS)
NLB supports content-based routing, while ALB supports IP-based routing
NLB provides cross-zone load balancing, while ALB does not

question: What is the purpose of health checks in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To monitor the performance of EC2 instances
To configure network security rules
To ensure that traffic is routed only to healthy targets
To establish secure connections between the load balancer and targets

question: Which load balancer type is deprecated in AWS Elastic Load Balancing, but still supported for existing applications?

answers.text: Application Load Balancer (ALB)
Network Load Balancer (NLB)
Classic Load Balancer (CLB)
Resource Load Balancer (RLB)

question: What is the purpose of sticky sessions in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To secure the communication between the load balancer and targets
To ensure that traffic is evenly distributed across targets
To bind a user's session to a specific target
To configure routing policies for EC2 instances

question: What is the key benefit of using an Elastic Load Balancer with Auto Scaling?

answers.text: Static distribution of traffic
Manual scaling of EC2 instances
Automatic adjustment of capacity based on demand
Application-level security for targets

question: Which AWS service can be integrated with Elastic Load Balancing to manage SSL/TLS certificates?

answers.text: Amazon RDS
AWS Key Management Service (KMS)
AWS Certificate Manager (ACM)
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

question: What is the purpose of the cross-zone load balancing feature in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To distribute traffic only within a single availability zone
To distribute traffic evenly across multiple availability zones
To route traffic based on content inspection
To manage the security of communication between the load balancer and targets

question: What is the maximum number of listeners that an Application Load Balancer (ALB) can support?

answers.text: Unlimited

question: Which load balancer type is best suited for distributing traffic across multiple services or containers within a single Amazon EC2 instance?

answers.text: Application Load Balancer (ALB)
Network Load Balancer (NLB)
Classic Load Balancer (CLB)

question: What is the key feature of a Network Load Balancer (NLB) related to IP addresses?

answers.text: Support for static IP addresses only
Dynamic assignment of IP addresses to targets
Usage of Elastic IP addresses for all targets
Restriction to private IP addresses only

question: Which load balancer type is best suited for handling WebSocket traffic?

answers.text: Application Load Balancer (ALB)
Network Load Balancer (NLB)
Classic Load Balancer (CLB)
Resource Load Balancer (RLB)

question: What is the purpose of a target group in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To define routing policies for the load balancer
To group and route traffic to one or more registered targets
To manage security groups for EC2 instances
To configure SSL/TLS certificates for the load balancer

question: How is traffic distributed among targets within a target group in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: Round-robin
Based on IP address range
Least connections
Randomly

question: What is the purpose of connection draining in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To route traffic based on content inspection
To ensure even distribution of traffic across targets
To allow in-flight requests to complete while deregistering targets
To manage SSL/TLS certificates for the load balancer

question: What is the primary benefit of using the AWS Global Accelerator with Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: Reduced latency for global applications
Increased security for EC2 instances
Automatic scaling of targets
Advanced content-based routing

question: How can you enforce SSL/TLS encryption for traffic between clients and an Application Load Balancer (ALB)?

answers.text: By configuring target groups
By using AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) certificates
By enabling connection draining
By setting up cross-zone load balancing

question: What is the purpose of a load balancer listener?

answers.text: To monitor the health of registered targets
To define the routing rules for incoming traffic
To manage SSL/TLS certificates for the load balancer
To distribute traffic based on IP address ranges

Amazon CloudWatch
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
AWS Config

question: What is the key benefit of using an Elastic Load Balancer with a fixed IP address?

answers.text: Dynamic assignment of IP addresses
Elastic IP address for all targets
Stable endpoint for DNS resolution
Cross-zone load balancing

answers.text: Application Load Balancer (ALB)
Network Load Balancer (NLB)
Classic Load Balancer (CLB)
Resource Load Balancer (RLB)

question: How can you configure routing based on the content of HTTP/HTTPS requests in an Application Load Balancer (ALB)?

answers.text: By using static IP addresses for targets
By configuring target groups
By using rules in a listener
By setting up cross-zone load balancing

question: What is the purpose of a load balancer policy in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To define security groups for EC2 instances
To enforce SSL/TLS encryption for traffic
To manage routing policies for targets
To configure health checks for the load balancer

question: How can you enable access logs for an Elastic Load Balancer?

answers.text: By configuring target groups
By using AWS CloudTrail
By enabling access logs in the load balancer settings
By associating an IAM role

question: What types of Elastic Load Balancers does AWS provide?

answers.text: Classic Load Balancer and Network Load Balancer
Network Load Balancer and Application Load Balancer
Classic Load Balancer and HTTP Load Balancer
Application Load Balancer and TCP Load Balancer

question: What is the main difference between Application Load Balancer and Network Load Balancer?

answers.text: Application Load Balancer operates at Layer 4, while Network Load Balancer operates at Layer 7
Application Load Balancer is designed for HTTP/HTTPS traffic, while Network Load Balancer is designed for TCP/UDP traffic
Application Load Balancer is region-specific, while Network Load Balancer is global
Application Load Balancer supports only IPv4, while Network Load Balancer supports both IPv4 and IPv6

question: What is the purpose of a listener in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To monitor load balancer performance
To control access to the load balancer
To define how traffic is routed to the targets
To log access patterns for analysis

question: In Elastic Load Balancing, what is the significance of a target group?

answers.text: It groups instances based on their geographical location
It defines the security groups associated with the load balancer
It routes traffic to registered targets based on health checks
It limits the number of connections to the load balancer

question: What is the purpose of health checks in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To monitor the overall health of AWS services
To ensure that the load balancer is running in a specific AWS region
To evaluate the health of registered targets and route traffic accordingly
To analyze the historical performance of the load balancer

question: How does the sticky session feature work in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: It maintains a persistent connection between the client and a specific target
It restricts access to the load balancer based on IP addresses
It limits the number of requests a client can make to the load balancer
It prevents distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks

question: What is the purpose of cross-zone load balancing in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To balance traffic evenly across multiple availability zones
To route traffic between different VPCs
To optimize SSL/TLS termination for HTTPS traffic
To prevent unauthorized access to the load balancer

question: What AWS service is commonly used in conjunction with Elastic Load Balancing for automatic scaling?

answers.text: AWS CloudTrail
AWS Auto Scaling
AWS CloudWatch
AWS Lambda

question: What is the maximum number of targets that you can register with an Elastic Load Balancer?

answers.text: Unlimited

question: What is the purpose of the stickiness duration in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To control the rate of traffic to the load balancer
To specify the time period during which requests from a client are directed to the same target
To configure custom error pages for the load balancer
To set the expiration time for SSL/TLS certificates

question: What is the significance of the connection draining feature in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To limit the number of connections to the load balancer
To gradually reroute traffic away from unhealthy instances during instance termination
To secure communication between the load balancer and targets
To manage access control lists (ACLs) for the load balancer

question: How does Elastic Load Balancing handle SSL/TLS termination?

answers.text: It doesn't support SSL/TLS termination
It offloads SSL/TLS decryption to the registered targets
It terminates SSL/TLS connections at the load balancer, and communicates with the targets using unencrypted connections
It uses AWS Key Management Service (KMS) to encrypt SSL/TLS traffic

question: What is the purpose of the idle timeout setting in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To limit the total duration of connections to the load balancer
To define the maximum number of idle connections allowed
To specify the time period after which an idle connection is closed
To configure the load balancer to automatically scale based on traffic

question: In Elastic Load Balancing, what is the purpose of the connection error metric?

answers.text: To measure the total number of connections to the load balancer
To track errors related to SSL/TLS termination
To monitor errors that occur during the establishment or closing of connections
To measure the latency of connections to the registered targets

question: What is the significance of the Backend Authentication setting in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To control access to the load balancer based on client certificates
To authenticate registered targets before forwarding traffic to them
To enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) for clients connecting to the load balancer
To enable secure communication between the load balancer and targets using SSL/TLS

question: How does the Connection Draining feature work in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: It limits the total number of connections to the load balancer
It gradually reroutes traffic away from unhealthy instances during instance termination
It prevents DDoS attacks by monitoring connection patterns
It optimizes SSL/TLS termination for HTTPS traffic

question: What is the purpose of the load balancer scheme in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To define the encryption scheme used for SSL/TLS traffic
To specify the number of load balancers in a high-availability configuration
To determine whether the load balancer is internal (accessible only from within the VPC) or internet-facing
To control the distribution of traffic among registered targets

question: What is the purpose of the [pre-warming] feature in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To warm up SSL/TLS connections before routing traffic to targets
To proactively monitor the health of targets and predict potential issues
To initialize the load balancer with a specified number of healthy instances before traffic is directed to it
To prevent connection errors by pre-allocating resources for anticipated traffic spikes

question: What is the purpose of the [Subnets] configuration in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To specify the IP addresses allowed to connect to the load balancer
To define the number of subnets in a VPC
To specify the availability zones in which the load balancer will distribute traffic
To configure custom error pages for the load balancer

question: What is the significance of the [Cross-Zone Load Balancing] setting in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To enable communication between load balancers in different AWS regions
To route traffic between different VPCs using cross-zone load balancing
To balance traffic evenly across multiple availability zones
To enforce strict security groups for cross-zone communication

question: What is the purpose of the [deletion protection] feature in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To prevent accidental deletion of the entire VPC
To protect against DDoS attacks targeting the load balancer
To prevent accidental deletion of the load balancer
To encrypt data transferred between the load balancer and targets

question: How does Elastic Load Balancing integrate with AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall)?

answers.text: It integrates directly with AWS WAF to inspect and filter traffic at the load balancer
It requires a separate AWS WAF instance to be deployed alongside the load balancer
It uses AWS Key Management Service (KMS) to encrypt communication with AWS WAF
It doesn't support integration with AWS WAF

question: What is the purpose of the [load balancer tags] feature in Elastic Load Balancing?

answers.text: To categorize and organize resources for billing purposes
To add metadata to the load balancer for better resource management
To define custom error pages for different sections of the load balancer
To associate AWS Lambda functions with specific load balancer events
